intro: Streptanthus flavescens, commonly known as the yellow sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard plants, and is characterized by its small, yellow flowers and hairy, glandular leaves. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain several seeds. Streptanthus flavescens is often found in disturbed areas and is adapted to thrive in arid or semi-arid conditions.
